untranslatedItems.text: The Declaration stated that the Estados Unidos was a free and independent nation.
[Traducción necesaria] No one is above the law
[Traducción necesaria] This phrase best summarizes the core principle of the rule of law.
[Traducción necesaria] Government must obey the law
[Traducción necesaria] The government itself is also bound by the law and cannot act outside its legal authority.
[Traducción necesaria] President (executive)
[Traducción necesaria] the courts (judicial)
[Traducción necesaria] The courts are the judicial branch, which interprets and applies laws.
[Traducción necesaria] Senate and House (of Representatives)
[Traducción necesaria] (U.S. or national) legislature
The U.S. legislature, which is el Congreso, has the constitutional authority to make federal laws.
[Traducción necesaria] (because) they have more people
[Traducción necesaria] States with larger populations get more representatives in the House.
[Traducción necesaria] (because) some states have more people
The number of representatives is directly related to ¿Cómo many people live in each state.
The Vice President succeeds to the presidency if el Presidente can no longer serve.
The Speaker of the House succeeds to the presidency only if both the President and Vice President can no longer serve.
The Chief Justice is not in the line of presidential succession.
The Secretary of State is fourth in the line of presidential succession.
The Secretary of State is fourth in the line of succession, after the Speaker of the House.
The Chief Justice is not in the line of presidential succession.
The President pro tempore of the Senate is fourth in line, after the Speaker of the House.
The Secretary of Defense is the civilian head of the Department of Defense, acting under the President's command.
The Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff is the highest-ranking military officer and the principal military advisor to the President.
The Vice President does not have direct command authority over the military.
The Speaker of the House leads the process for a bill to pass the House, but does not have the final authority to sign it into law.
The Vice President can cast a tie-breaking vote in the Senate but does not sign bills into law.
The Chief Justice interprets laws and is not involved in the legislative process.
The Supreme Court can rule a law unconstitutional after it is enacted, but it cannot veto a bill.
The Cabinet, composed of the heads of executive departments, provides expert advice to el Presidente.
The President is elected by the people and the Electoral College.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of State
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of State is a key cabinet member responsible for foreign policy.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of the Treasury
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for the nation's financial and economic policy.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Defense
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Defense oversees military and defense policy.
[Traducción necesaria] Attorney General
[Traducción necesaria] The Attorney General is the head of the Department of Justice and the chief law enforcement officer.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Agriculture
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Agriculture oversees farming, food safety, and rural development policies.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Commerce
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Commerce promotes economic growth and trade.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Education
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Education oversees federal education policy and programs.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Energy
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Energy manages energy policy and nuclear security.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Health and Human Services
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Health and Human Services oversees health and welfare programs.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Homeland Security
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Homeland Security protects the nation from security threats.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development oversees housing and urban development policies.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of the Interior
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of the Interior manages public lands and natural resources.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Labor
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Labor oversees workplace safety and labor relations.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Transportation
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Transportation oversees transportation infrastructure and safety.
[Traducción necesaria] Secretary of Veterans Affairs
[Traducción necesaria] The Secretary of Veterans Affairs provides services to military veterans.
[Traducción necesaria] Vice President
[Traducción necesaria] The Vice President is also considered a Cabinet-level position.
[Traducción necesaria] reviews laws
[Traducción necesaria] The judicial branch reviews laws to ensure they are constitutional.
[Traducción necesaria] explains laws
[Traducción necesaria] The judicial branch interprets the meaning of laws and applies them to specific cases.
[Traducción necesaria] resolves disputes
[Traducción necesaria] It resolves legal disputes by making rulings.
[Traducción necesaria] The judicial branch has the power of judicial review to determine if laws are constitutional.
The International Court of Justice is a UN judicial body that handles disputes between countries.
The number of justices is set by law and has been nine since 1869.
[Traducción necesaria] John Roberts
[Traducción necesaria] John G. Roberts, Jr. is the 17th and current Chief Justice.
[Traducción necesaria] to print money
[Traducción necesaria] Printing money is an exclusive power of the federal government.
[Traducción necesaria] to declare war
[Traducción necesaria] to create an army
[Traducción necesaria] Creating and maintaining an army for national defense is a role of the federal government.
[Traducción necesaria] to make treaties
[Traducción necesaria] Making official treaties with other countries is a power of the federal government.
[Traducción necesaria] provide schooling and education
[Traducción necesaria] Education policy and school operation are primarily the responsibility of the states.
[Traducción necesaria] provide protection (police)
[Traducción necesaria] Maintaining public order by operating state and local police is a state power.
[Traducción necesaria] give a driver's license
[Traducción necesaria] Each state sets its own standards and procedures for issuing driver's licenses.
[Traducción necesaria] provide safety (fire departments)
[Traducción necesaria] Fire protection and safety services are typically provided by state and local governments.
[Traducción necesaria] approve zoning and land use
[Traducción necesaria] States have the authority to regulate land use and zoning within their boundaries.
The Mayor is the head of a city government, different from the Governor who is the head of the entire state.
The President is the head of the federal government, different from the Governor who is the head of a state government.
[Traducción necesaria] Democratic and Republican
[Traducción necesaria] The Democratic and Republican parties are the two major parties that dominate U.S. politics today.
The Labour and Conservative parties are the major political parties in the United Kingdom.
The Senate and House are the two parts of Congress, not political parties.
[Traducción necesaria] Republican (Party)
[Traducción necesaria] President Donald Trump is a member of the Republican Party. (As of July 2025)
The Democratic Party is currently the main opposition party.
